channel.title: Money Moves
channel.description: Hosted by Lauren Simmons, the youngest person ever to trade on the New York Stock Exchange, Money Moves is your new go-to live show where Lauren shares tips on how to make money work for you and shift your financial mindset to live your best life.

item.title: How to Start a Side Business
item.description: This week, Lauren kicks off the convo talking about the Netflix stock dropping 37% - what caused this, and will Netflix be able to recover? Later, she gives tips on how to turn your side hustle into a business and the art of negotiating and understanding your value. Tune into Money Moves every other Wednesday at 10pm ET live on Spotify.

item.title: This is Money Moves
item.description: Welcome to Money Moves! Every other Wednesday at 10p ET / 7p PT host Lauren Simmons goes live to help YOU navigate your financial future. This isn't professional advice, it’s about what will work for you based on Lauren's experiences and research. Whether it’s about saving, investing, or which industry is on the rise — MONEY MOVES is a discussion intended to help you choose the financial path that makes the most sense for you.

item.title: Preparing for a Recession: How to Save and Be Safe Financially
item.description: This week, Lauren begins the episode explaining stock splits and how to know when and how much to invest. She later teaches listeners how to financially prepare for a recession, and pulls back the curtain on Web 3.0, the Metaverse, and how it will change your finances. Follow Money Moves in Spotify Greenroom to join the next live show! https://spotifygr.link/moneymoveslive

item.title: Finding a New Job While Still in a Pandemic
item.description: Lauren's mom and HR vet, Kim Simmons, joins the show to discuss navigating the job market and shares important info to know about the recruiting process. Kim and Lauren discuss navigating the job search during the pandemic. Later they talk about how the industry is changing, finding the right mentors, and tips on interviewing and negotiating salary and benefits.  Follow Money Moves in Spotify Greenroom to join the next live show! https://spotifygr.link/moneymoveslive

item.title: How the War in Ukraine Impacts Our Finances
item.description: What do Russia's actions in Ukraine mean for you and your money? Join Lauren as she describes the effect that the war in Ukraine will have on international finances and markets. She then addresses the surge in oil& gas prices and continues with a discussion of how people can contribute to programs that help people affected by this tragedy. Follow Money Moves in Spotify Greenroom to join the next live show! https://spotifygr.link/moneymoveslive

item.title: The Wolfette of Wall Street
item.description: This week, Lauren shares gems on saving and budgeting. She explains the trusty 50-30-20 rule, and some useful investment tools and resources. Later she tells listeners how to look for a financial advisor or robo advisor, and even discusses her skepticism about NFTs. Follow Money Moves in Spotify Greenroom to join the next live show! https://spotifygr.link/moneymoveslive

item.title: Welcome to Money Moves!
item.description: Mind Body Wealth is now Money Moves — Lauren Simmon's live show! Money Moves is intended to help you make your financial future as bright as possible. This isn’t a professional consultation. It’s someone who’s had financial success and wants to help you with yours — in real time. You can join every other Wednesday LIVE at 10p ET/7p PT right here on Spotify.

item.title: How to Show Up for the Black Community Year Round
item.description: This week, Lauren kicks off the show with some investing advice. How can you diversify your portfolio? Should You invest in ETFs? And later, as we enter Black History Month, Lauren gives listeners advice and tips on how to show up for and support the Black community all year round. Follow Money Moves in Spotify Greenroom to join the show! https://spotifygr.link/moneymoveslive

item.title: Networking is Your Best Friend
item.description: Gen Z thought leader and fellow Spotify Greenroom host Gigi Robinson joins Lauren in a career conversation. Listen to hear tips on networking, interviewing, and negotiation tactics then follow Money Moves in Spotify Greenroom to get notified when the show is live next! https://spotifygr.link/moneymoveslive Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Goal Setting and Trend Forecasting with College Hoops Star Cameron Brink!
item.description: New year, new habits. Lauren talks the magic of intentionality and techniques for setting goals. Plus, college hooper Cameron Brink joins to chat about finding her brand and trends she sees for this year. Follow Money Moves in Spotify Greenroom to join the show! https://spotifygr.link/moneymoveslive Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Give More, Give Differently
item.description: Wealth isn’t all about money. Lauren & Libyan-American activist-journalist, Noor Tagouri, discuss how it’s also tied to how we feel when we’re giving of our time & energy, showing up for our people & communities, & being in service to others. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Holiday Spending Dos and Don'ts
item.description: It's that most stressful time of year, and Lauren breaks down how to get the most out of your giving without breaking the bank. Plus: listeners get some advice on credit cards and gifting NFTs. Follow Money Moves in Spotify Greenroom to join the show live every Wednesday! https://spotifygr.link/moneymoveslive Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: NFT Dreams
item.description: From streetwear designer to NFT owner, Jeff Staple talks to Lauren about getting into this digital market just 6 months ago, and how NFTs and disposable income can create opportunities for generational wealth. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: When Does Faking It Cross the Line?
item.description: Sometimes you have to fake til you make it. But when does it cross the line? Lauren chats with listeners about it, manifesting greatness, and what do with imposter syndrome. Follow Money Moves in Spotify Greenroom to join the show live https://spotifygr.link/moneymoveslive Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Party of 1
item.description: From being at home to blocking internet trolls, Lauren and digital fitness entrepreneur, Tamara Anthony, talk about the benefits of being alone, taking time to get to know oneself, and setting healthy boundaries for a more fulfilled life.  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Getting Serious about Dating and Finances
item.description: This week, Lauren chats with listeners about money & dating - from the tough conversations to financial dealbreakers and setting boundaries. Be sure to follow Money Moves in Spotify Greenroom to join the show live https://spotifygr.link/moneymoveslive Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: You Can’t Please Everyone
item.description: Content creator, brand marketing manager, and overall multi-hyphenate Chantal Rochelle gets real about the physical burnout she experienced when neglecting to prioritize herself. She and Lauren discuss the importance of practicing time management, discerning boundaries, and simply slowing down. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: PREMIERE: Welcome to Money Moves
item.description: Money Moves is a new live show where YOU can join in the experience and have deeper conversations about financial literacy. In this first episode, Lauren shares her experience, talks about when to invest, and takes questions from listeners about financial advisors. Money Moves is LIVE in Spotify Greenroom every Wednesday at 10p ET. Download the app and follow the show to join the discussion! https://spotifygr.link/moneymoveslive Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Making Money Not Taboo
item.description: Personal finance expert, Chris Browning, and international banker, Guy Heichman, had different experiences around financial stability & money talks with their parents growing up. Today, they share what they’ve learned & unlearned driving toward financial & career success. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Don’t Die Empty
item.description: NFL linebacker & Ivy League professor, Brandon Copeland talks about leading a purpose-driven life off the field, how purpose & passions inform the money mindset, and his each one teach one approach to financial empowerment within his community. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: A Tribe Called Your Network
item.description: Mary Elizabeth Taylor, the first & youngest African American Assistant Secretary of State for Legislative Affairs, discusses self-care, the importance of the group chat and cultivating an authentic tribe you can turn to and lean on with confidence. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Quick Fight? Quicker Recovery!
item.description: Headhunted for a hedge fund at 17, expert entrepreneur, Sophie Bakalar, shares insight into the entrepreneurial mindset, qualities of an ideal co-founder, and how her sibling relationship prepared her for multiple entrepreneurial endeavors. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: What’s Your Number?
item.description: $95k? $150k? How much do you need to earn to feel secure in your day-to-day? Lauren and award-winning film and TV producer, Jesse Murphy, share their number, discuss the cost of doubt, and offer ways to overcome investment imposter syndrome. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: High Risk, High Reward
item.description: Learn from two L’s—Lauren & Chief of Staff at Google, Lauren Legette—how to win at angel investing, why neither women are keen on high-risk investments, and why you definitely need a financial advisor. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Senior Leader Energy
item.description: Leadership style, self-awareness, authenticity & more--today, Lauren talks the traits & characteristics of successful tastemakers, and discusses code switching & being choosy about opportunities w/ financial entrepreneur, Jared Schwitzke. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Introducing Mind Body Wealth
item.description: Mind Body Wealth—it's all interconnected with host Lauren Simmons, the youngest person to ever trade on the New York Stock Exchange. Listen and shift your money mindset every week with Lauren and special guests as she navigates the nuances of our personal relationships with money and finances, and shows you how to make money work for you so you can live your best life. New episodes every Wednesday, only on Spotify. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Money Moves & Sound Investments
item.description: First-gen immigrant, Chef Jordan Andino, shares how a $13k credit “mistake” was actually a life-changing investment. And from Nipsey Hustle to Warren Buffet, Lauren breaks down both sides of the bitcoin debate and her thoughts on cryptocurrency. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices
